content:
MBL Embryology Course
J.R. Whittaker
June, 1988
A SIMPLE AND HIGHLY SENSITIVE ONE-STEP HISTOCHEMICAL ASSAY FOR
LOCALIZATIONS OF ALKALINE PHOSPHATASE: An indoxyl tetrazolium
method for non-specific alkaline phosphatase
The method as described is for staining whole small invertebrate
embryos.
Most satisfactory fixative is SZ formaldehyde in sea water.
Prepared by adding 2 ml 25% para-formaldehyde to 8 ml of filtered
sea water. The p-formaldehyde solution should be relatively fresh
(not more than a month old) and adjusted to neutral pH at the time
of its preparation to prevent breakdown to methanol.
Fixation in the p-form is for a period 15-30 min at SOC on ice.
There are some situations in which 80% ethanol works better as a
fixative, especially whereo the species has a thick larval test.
Fixation After fixation, rinse once in Reaction Medium then incubate in
Reaction Medium for 30-90 min at Reaction Medium
contains the substrate bromochloroindolyl phosphate and the
electron (hydrogen) acceptor Nitro*BT.
The localized reaction of alkaline phosphatase appears first as a
faint chartreuse-blue color; as the enzyme continues to react, the
product deepens in color to a darker blue. Since AlkP is a minor
component of all tissues, with longer incubation times the
background reaction in other tissues will eventually deepen and
serve to obscure any differential staining.
when ethanol is used as a fixative, the tissues are rendered
somewhat more permeable to reagents, and a sufficient differential
staining reaction may occur within 10-15 min.
The reaction is stopped by moving the specimens to 352 ethanol
where the color will deepen but remain stable for several days.
As soon as possible, samples should be run up rapidly through a
graded series of alcohol concentrations to xylene and mounted in
dam ar or balsam resin. If left in absolute ethanol the tissues
gradually destain; they ldestain overnight in xylene. After
specimens are mounted in resin the stain seems to be permanent.
Reagents and Solutions:
1. 25% p-formaldehyde Solution
25 para-formalgehyde in 100 ml distilled water dissolved
by heating to 60 and adding 1N dropwise until soln
clears. Neutralize the resulting soln to pH 7.0 with 1N
Filter and store at
